sen.e: OE no Hiromoto (1148-July 16, 1225) was a governmental official responsible for practical works in the end of Heian period.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の政所初代別当（長官）。

sen.e: He was the first chief officer of Administrative Board for Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 最初は朝廷に仕える下級貴族のいわゆる官人であったが、鎌倉に下って源頼朝の側近官僚となり、鎌倉幕府の創設に貢献した。
sen.e: He was originally a so-called government official from lower-ranking nobles (esp. one of low to medium rank) that served the imperial court, and later he went down to Kamakura to be a official as a close adviser for MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, contributing to establish Kamakura Bakufu.

sen.j: しかし1960年（昭和35年）に石母田正がこの問題を詳細に分析し、これは幕府独自の記録によったものではなく、鎌倉時代の後期の一般的な通説に基づく作文ではないかと指摘する。

sen.j: そこから盛んな論争が巻き起こり、現在では広元の献策「権門勢家の庄公を論ぜず、兵粮米（段別五升）を宛て課す」は、「諸国平均」ではなく「五畿・山陰・山陽・南海・西海諸国」であるとされている。
sen.e: Then, a feverish controversy occurred, nowadays, it is regarded the Hiromoto's proposed policy; `imposing tax on rice (5-sho per tan) regardless of private estate or public estate' was not for `all the countries,' but for `Goki (Yamato, Yamashiro, Settsu, Kochi and Izumi Provinces), the Sanin (mountain provinces behind the Sanyo or Inland Sea provinces), the Sanyo (Inland Sea provinces), the Nankai (southern provinces), the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast).'

sen.j: また、「守護」職はこのときではなく、1185年での要求は源義経・源行家の捜索・追捕を名目とした一国単位の「国地頭」と「総追捕使」であって、室町時代にまで繋がる守護職の発端は1190年（建久元年）に頼朝が初めて上京し、後白河法皇や九条兼実らと合意した「諸国守護」を奉行する権限にあるとされている。
sen.e: Besides, post of `shugo' (provincial constable) was not established this time; the establishment of `kuni jito' (the appointment of provincial jito to each province) and `So-tsuibushi' (job title which has rights of government, military affair and police authority) in each country on the purpose of searching and capturing MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune and MINAMOTO no Yukiie, which was just nominal, was demanded in 1185, and the origin of shugo which would continue until the Muromachi period was the authority which was agreed between Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa, Kanezane KUJO and Yoritomo to enforce 'syugo in all the countries' when Yoritomo came out to Kyoto for the first time in 1190.

sen.j: 広島市の地名は、広元の子孫・毛利輝元が1589年（天正17年）広島城築城の鍬入れの時に、毛利氏の祖先である広元から一字を採って命名したといわれている（諸説あり）。
sen.e: Hiroshima City (広島市) was named taking one character 広 from Hiromoto 広元 which was the ancestor of the Mori clan, When Hiromoto's descendant, Terumoto MORI performed a ritual of spading the ground of a newly built Hiroshima castle in 1589 (various theories as to this).
